snippet: Michelle Bachelet received about 62 percent of the vote, according to preliminary results, amid continuing unease over high levels of inequality in Chile.
abstract: Michelle Bachelet is elected president of Chile, winning landslide 62 percent of vote amid continuing unease over high levels of income inequality despite rapid economic growth; win marks return to office for Bachelet, who was widely admired as president from 2006 to 2010, when her policies helped shield Chile from sharp downturn during global financial crisis.

byline.original: By SIMON ROMERO and PASCALE BONNEFOY

lead_paragraph: Michelle Bachelet received about 62 percent of the vote, according to preliminary results, amid continuing unease over high levels of inequality in Chile.

headline.main: Chilean Voters Return a Former President to Power
headline.print_headline: Chilean Voters Return a Former President to Power
